item.title: Melissa add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "In these days of difficulty, we Americans everywhere must and shall choose the path of social justice…, the path of faith, the path of hope, and the path of love toward our fellow man." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Philip Gourevitch
item.description: "Denouncing evil is a far cry from doing good." -- Philip Gourevitch

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jean Vanier
item.description: "True peace can rarely be imposed from the outside; it must be born within and between communities through meetings and dialogue and then carried outward." -- Jean Vanier

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Gustavo Gutiérrez
item.description: "If there is no friendship with them [the poor] and no sharing of the life of the poor, then there is no authentic commitment to liberation, because love exists only among equals." -- Gustavo Gutiérrez

item.title: Melissa add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I know, up on top you are seeing great sights, but down here at the bottom we, too, should have rights." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "It's what you do that makes your soul." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I'm of a fearsome mind to throw my arms around every living librarian who crosses my path, on behalf of the souls they never knew they saved. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Doris Haddock
item.description: "Let us choose life and love, and happily use our selves up in loving service to one another." -- Doris Haddock

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Doris Haddock
item.description: "I'm not against the corporations. They are our wealth. But they are getting too greedy. I don't want to do away with corporations. I want them to make our cars, however, not our laws." -- Doris Haddock

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Doris Haddock
item.description: "There are two kinds of politics in the world: the politics of love and the politics of fear." -- Doris Haddock

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Doris Haddock
item.description: "Love is about cooperation, sharing and inclusion. It is about the elevation of each individual to a life neither suppressed nor exploited, but instead nourished to rise to its full potential--a life for its own sake and so that we may all benefit by the gift of that life." -- Doris Haddock

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Marsha Norman
item.description: "Dreams are illustrations...from the book your soul is writing about you." -- Marsha Norman

item.title: Melissa add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson
